qas.question: How many sorties were flown in March 1941?
When did the Luftwaffe fly inland missions?
How did the Germans confuse the British?

answers.text: radio silence was observed until the bombs fell

qas.question: Why was the X-Gerat frequencies used more?

answers.text: British selective jamming was degrading the effectiveness of Y-Gerät

context: From the German point of view, March 1941 saw an improvement. The Luftwaffe flew <a0_0>4,000<a0_0/> sorties that month, including 12 major and three heavy attacks. The electronic war intensified but the Luftwaffe flew major inland missions <a1_0>only on moonlit nights<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Ports were easier to find<a2_0/> and made better targets. To confuse the British, <a3_0>radio silence was observed until the bombs fell<a3_0/>. X- and Y-Gerät beams were placed over false targets and switched only at the last minute. Rapid frequency changes were introduced for X-Gerät, whose wider band of frequencies and greater tactical flexibility ensured it remained effective at a time when <a4_0>British selective jamming was degrading the effectiveness of Y-Gerät<a4_0/>.
